turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Then she said -- she loves me.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Oh shit dude, the L-word!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You ever hear of something called The Bible?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Once, in church, dude.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Dude, I wish you wouldn't do that.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You got something up your sleeve for tonight, Finch?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: And little hurly-burly came by in her curly-wurly, and asked me if I needed I ri-hide --

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: How the hell do you know all these random songs?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: It's early Springsteen, dude, this is classic.  This was before the cheesy remake.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Contact, dude.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Then where does a blowjob figure in?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Feeling better, Oz?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I'm such a loser.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: That's the spirit.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I put in months of quality time with Vicky.  Sherman meets a chick for one night and scores?  This is just wrong.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: No shit, I'm never gonna get laid. How the hell am I gonna become this Mr. Sensitive Man?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Dude, it's not like I haven't been trying to get laid.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: This is different.  This is better. Think of when you're working out, Oz. You need a partner, someone to spot you.  Someone to keep you motivated.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: The Sha-lin masters from east and west must unite!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Guys, guys -- you're ruining my fucking moment here.  Now think about it --

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: So, I'm thinking prom is basically our last big chance.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Dude, prom sucks.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I know, but think about it -- At the parties that night.  Chicks are gonna want to do it.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: So does your tongue cramp up?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Nah, you get kind of dizzy though.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: What reputation?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Observe.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Okay, explain.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I can't, I have no idea how he's doing it.  And that leaves you trailing, Jim.  You gotta get your act together.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Dammit, Kevin, what's with the attitude?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Attitude?  Me?  I think that <u>you</u> guys should be more enthusiastic.  Shit, we've been trying to get laid forever, and tonight's the night we've been waiting for.  We're in this together. Don't back out on me now!

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Kevin, it was just a --

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: <u>It was a pact</u>.  You break it and there are no excuses.  You guys have to --

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: ...Guess what?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I don't care.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: And by the way, Sherman didn't even get laid.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: He didn't?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I guess we'll call you two-ply.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Yeah.  So you want double condiments on that?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Wow.  You two really have something going, don't you?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I think we're falling in love.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Yeah, but we'll still see each other.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Fuck yeah we will.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: NOVA!!

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Stifler!!

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: You coming to party tonight, Ostreicher, ya fuckface?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Depends if my date wants to stop by.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: That junior chick?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Nah, gave her the Heisman.  I'm working on something new.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Yeah right.  I got an idea for something new.  How 'bout you guys actually locate your dicks, remove the shrink wrap, and fuckin' use 'em.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Dude, it's gotta happen -- she's a college chick!

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Bullshit.  From where?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: She works part-time at my dad's store.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Hah!  Yeah, Oz, I bet it's more like your dad works at <u>her</u> store.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Dude, he does not.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: You actually said that?!  Haaaah!!

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Shut the fuck up.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: I think you need your balls reattached.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Keep it down, dude.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: What the fuck are you doing here?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: This place is an untapped resource. Check it out, dude, these vocal jazz girls are <u>hot</u>.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: You dipshit, you're expecting to score with some goody-goody choir-girl priss?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Dude, watch me work.  They go for sensitive studs like me.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: <u>Yeah</u>!

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Well, just don't expect Oz to pay for the limo.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Stifler, fuck --  ...man, you don't have to be so insensitive.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Hey, you know, what can I say, I dig those cute little sweaters she wears.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: I'll bet you do, you little horndog, she's givin' you fuckin' stiffies, right?

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Oh my fucking God.  You're gay.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Come on, you know the words, sing along.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: No thanks, you've been singing that shit all week.  If you try that at MSU this Saturday, I'm pretending I don't know you.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Our last game is this Saturday.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: No shit.

turns.speaker: SOPHOMORE CHICK
turns.text: God, I can't believe there are so many cool people at this party.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Here, babe.

turns.speaker: SOPHOMORE CHICK
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: SOPHOMORE CHICK
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: SOPHOMORE CHICK
turns.text: I don't know if I want to be doing this.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Doing what?

turns.speaker: SOPHOMORE CHICK
turns.text: You know.  If we hook up, tomorrow I'll just be some girl you go telling all your friends about.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Hanging is nice. Never goes out of style. What about hare-kare - a taste of the Orient? But no! You're in Paris! Try the Guillotine! There's one in the Louvre!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I'd use pills. They're painless.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Oh give me a break! He could use pills back in America! Why not get a little culture?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Let's face it. It's a, how do you say... mother-fucker. But we're all in it together. That's why we're trying to help you.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Merde! Just missed!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Uhh! Would you die already!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Geez, I feel bad for him. Maybe we should've told him abou -

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Are you crazy!? You know that's totally impractical. Besides, like the Bible says...  An eye for an eye...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Look, the more you think about it, the harder it is.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Just like sex with my wife.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: The key is don't look down.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Also like sex with my wife.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Would you shut up?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Tell you what, we'll jump together.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Sure. We wouldn't ask you to do anything we wouldn't do. Now give me your hand... that's it...

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Merde! I can't believe this!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You try to be a good sport, and look what happens.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I mean, if by some miracle you can find the werewolf that bit you, and then manage to eat it's heart, the curse is lifted. I was gonna tell you but Marcel wouldn't let me.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Oh sure, it was all mean old Marcel's idea. Give me a break! We didn't tell you because it's a wild goose chase! Not to mention disgusting. Look...

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Either way works for us...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: But you better hurry.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Actually, I'm waiting for someone.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What a coincidence, I am someone!  Mmm. Calvin Klein's Obsession. Now it's mine too.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: God. How can you eat like that?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: It's all in the tongue. Another bottle?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Wow. You know Kung Fu or something?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah. Apparently.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Ha ha. You were probably right about his mom.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hope I didn't hurt him too bad.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Who gives a shit? I've had it up to here with arrogant Frenchmen.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Up to there? Really? I bet I could beat that.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Ha ha! Yeah right, white boy! Ha Ha ha.  I think maybe I drank too much.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Ah. The mating call of the blonde. The night is young, the moon is bright, whataya feel like doing tonight?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I don't know... Surprise me.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Ahh! Jesus! You're burning hot! What the hell -

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: AHHHHHHH!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Thanks for the lovely evening, shithead!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Aaaaa! Jesus! This isn't happening. I'm still hallucinating. Shit!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Face it boyfriend. This is really happening.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: No it isn't! You're dead!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Okay... dead or undead... what do you want from me?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: A-duh... You're a werewolf. And we, as your victims, have to walk the earth until your curse is lifted.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Uh huh... And, supposing I believed that, what could I do about it?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Look, I didn't mean to hurt anybody... God, I didn't mean to... to...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Rip my face off? Hey, we all make mistakes. Hell, I didn't mean to sleep with you on the first night, especially without a condom. But I did, and now I'm paying the price.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hey, you can't kick me! You're an apparition!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What, all of a sudden you got a degree in supernatural law?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Ha-ha!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Oh, big man. You can beat up a couple of cadavers. Well let me make something real clear, asshole. If you don't kill yourself, at midnight tonight you're gonna transform and murder innocent people!

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Oh fuck, you are his nephew...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah, that's the word. And you are?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Serafine Flocquet. I work for your uncle.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You? You're Madame Flocquet? I pictured a fat lady with an apron, not - I don't know - La Femme Nikita.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Sure. I can follow that.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: It's a fucking nightmare, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah. True. The cops weren't much help either. Their theory is he was moonlighting as a drug dealer or something. Make sense to you?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Police. They have their head in their asshole and they still can't find shit.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Well put. So, what exactly has uncle Terrence been up to lately?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Salots! Shitfucker!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: If you leave it for more than a few minutes it locks up. Now I must reboot and type a dozen fucking passwords. He was security crazy.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: You must not have known him very well. He's not like that.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hey, Sorry if I was out of line.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: You were. I have work to do. The publisher wants the transcripts by Monday. Go. Make yourself at home.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Fine. My mistake. You know, I'm gonna be a writer myself some day.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Uh-huh. Good for you.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Medusa... What's this? some kind of club?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: It's nothing. A stupid party. Not really a night club, it's, uh...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Like an underground club?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Yes. It's a bad place. Weird people. Strange things go on.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: And who's Claude?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Professor Claude Rousel. The one your uncle was working with. He teaches cultural history.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: In an underground club? I'd like to see that.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: I'm serious. There's nothing for you down there. It's dangerous.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Come on. I'm from New York - the "shoot me" state. Don't wait up.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: What good can you do? Why are you being so fucking stupid?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Maybe I didn't know him like you did. But he's my uncle. And I owe it to him to get some answers. It's a quest like, uh, Hemingway, the Old Man and The Sea. Except instead of an old man I'm a young man, and instead of the sea, it's a bunch of tunnels under Paris. And instead of a big fish it's... who knows? That's what I'm going to find out. Au revoir.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Wait a second, are you like the Steven King of France or something...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Andy!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: So you came after all. Just in time, it's getting interesting.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: You must get out of here. It's not safe.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Andy! Holy shit!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Serafine...?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Thank God! What a relief! I thought... After you disappeared... I couldn't find you... I thought all sorts of horrible things...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah... Ditto. I saw, er, I thought I saw you get munched... like Uncle Terrence...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: What happened? Did you cut yourself?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Um... sort of... Maybe... It's all kind of blurry. We met at the club, then... Damn, that was some weird shit.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: You have to be a hero. All Americans think they are cowboys.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I was an Indian, actually. Man, that damn psycho paint...! If that's supposed to be mild, I don't want to know about medium.  The planet earth. It's good to be back.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: So... you feel okay now?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Fan-fucking-tastic?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hey, what more could I want? I survived my first and last hallucinogenic hellride, and neither of us is dead. I'd say I feel almost as great as you look.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Come on Serafine. Let's go out. Show me the real Paris, the part that isn't overpriced and overrun with German tourists.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Go to Jim Morrison's grave at Pere Lachaise. It's overrun with American tourists. I have to work.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I know! Let's go hock loogies off the Eiffel Tower!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What about food? Even beautiful women have to eat. It's true. I read it. Please? A half an hour?  My treat?  Pleez! Don't make go out there alone again! I'm begging you!

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Okay. But I'm back in half an hour.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: What about your glasses?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: It's okay. I can see fine.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Don't you want to change?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Man! Our first date and already you're trying to get me to change! You French women work quick!

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Shit! You bought enough pate for a fucking army!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: So tell me, exactly which truck driver did you study English with?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Like I should talk. Monsieur foot-in- the-mouth. I'm really sorry about that whole Woody Allen thing...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: So's Woody Allen.  No, your uncle really helped me. I was sort of messed up for a while. Wasting my time just partying and... just stupid shit. He kind of woke me up, gave me a job, got me taking classes.  You know, he and Claude, their work is controversial, but they're serious about it. Totally dedicated.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: That's what counts. If you're not passionate about it, don't waste your time. That's why I quit college... Plus I'm a lazy bastard.  Wait, I know this... A votre sante.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: A la votre.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: This looks familiar...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Ahh, Rodin. Mmm! He's the fuc-  I mean, he's the best. You must go to the Rodin sculpture garden, in the huitieme, it's so beautiful.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Serafine...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: I'll be right back. Stay put.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Fixing your makeup with a phone, huh? Who the fuck are you calling?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Professor Roussel. There's something wrong with you. I know it.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Roussel? You mean Claude? You're calling Dr. Demento so he can come paint my face again? Fuck that.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: No, I don't think so... I was having a nightmare. Wait a second...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Where did you go last night? What did you do?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I don't... I... I can't remember...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Listen, I'm coming over. Don't go anywhere. Stay right there.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I'm not alright. We both know that. The only reason I'm here now is to warn you. You're still in danger. Gaston told me that Claude has got the curse too. He's a werewolf.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: I know. He told me.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What?! He told you? When?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You two faced bastard. I knew you were full of shit.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Andy! No!

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Because, Andy. It's a cure.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: A cure?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Andy... I should never have let you go underground. I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I had to be a damn Hemingway hero. Well I'll tell ya, the old man and the sea didn't go through half this shit.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: What makes you so sure this will work?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I told you. He already tried to contact me once. If you saw his face... He was desperate to tell me something. I owe him this.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Listen, either he wastes away as a pathetic vegetable or he can give what's left of his life to save hundreds of potential victims. He's a McDermott. I know what his choice would be.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: I suppose you're right. But I still don't like it.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: They're coming!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Shit. What have I done?  Stall them! I'll meet you out back.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I saw him. Just before those bastards zapped him back. The ADM is in the wine cellar, in a bottle of Chateau Margaux.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: I didn't know he had a wine cellar.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Guess that's why he hid it there. Let's go.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Are you crazy!?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Before Hemingway, there was Starsky and Hutch.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What the fuck!? You too!?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: I... I didn't think you would... I'm sorry... I believed that son-of-a- bitch...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: I hope they fucking fry us all.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah. French fries...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Holy mother of God...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Fuck me...

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Andy?... What? What is it?  Andy... are you okay?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: It was you... That night in the tunnels. You. You did this to me.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: No I.... Andy, you can't be sure.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: That's the scar where I stabbed you! Oh God... You deliberately took me down there so you could... God, I can't believe it!

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: You made me go there. I tried to stop you! You wouldn't listen!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What was I? Your idea of a fuckin' hors d'oeuvre? Huh?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Shut up! You fucking shut up! What do you want? Huh? What the hell do you want?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Here! Come on! Do it! Go ahead.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What...?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: You know what. Kill me. Cut out my fucking heart. Go on! Do it!

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: We don't both have to die.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I couldn't do it. Not to you.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: We can't stop him. Not now. Handcuffed, with no kind of weapons. Please Andy...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: No. We have to try. We'll figure something out. And if midnight comes before we can get to him, well, then we go together. Deal?  Shake a paw?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: I know where he'll go.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: Somewhere where there are no police, and plenty to eat.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Didn't even have to ask.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: All your weapons, on the floor! Now!

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: No wonder he let her go.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: God. I can't believe it.

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: It's making me hungry.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What does it say?

turns.speaker: SERAFINE
turns.text: "Stop! Beyond this passage lie the catacombs of Paris: the exclusive domain of the dead."
